newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Anglo says rand volatility waning.
newsitem.headline: Anglo says rand volatility waning.

text.p: The rand's recent instability was starting to ebb and the currency's fall was beginning to bottom out, Anglo American Corp of South Africa Ltd said on Thursday.
Speaking at the presentation of third quarter gold results, Anglo marketing director Kelvin Williams said: "It may well be that our currency is returning to normal levels of volatility."
He also said South Africa could take comfort from the fact that capital was returning to the country.
"There is some comfort in the fact that the free fall volatility of the rand has subsided and in the information that capital flows into the country appear to have resumed."
After losing more than 25 percent of its value against the dollar since the middle of February, the rand fell in early trade on Thursday to be last bid at 4.5625 against the U.S. currency.
